posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hail comrades! Hopefully a quick question for you...

I've been noodling about with Barbarians again (stop it - you're better than that 😉), primarily because I've been missing some "Hulk bash, Hulk smash!" lately, and may have to resort to kicking small yappy dogs over garden walls if I don't get another meleer up and running. Anyway, to the question...

Assuming you're taking both Terrifying and Mighty Rage (both as Barb bonus feats, in all likelihood), which would you take first - assuming you qualify for both by the mid 20s?

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks, both.

I confess, that's pretty much as I expected, but I wanted to pose the question just in case I was simply falling back on precedent without any real thought - much as years ago many Barb builds incorporated Thundering Rage, until its utility was called into question. I just didn't want to blindly make assumptions.

Right, back to my noodling (all the while bewailing being forbidden from making a Barbarian Dwarven Defender - curse those NwN gods!).

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: I wouldn't mind rage temporarily raising base Str instead instead of contributing to the +12 ability cap, without terrifying rage, its making empowered bull's strength better than barbarian rage :(

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I think that is one of the "holy grails" of NWN - making Barb Rage great again! (in PnP it works this way).

Although I think with the new changes to the engine, it should be possible ala how they now do RDDs.

If it was possible - Barb/Bard/RDD.  Oh yeah!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
That's a fair point about Strength, but Raging brings other things as well: the Constitution and Will boosts don't hurt (though the dip in AC, except in its Mighty incarnation, is a bummer); and the paralyzing effect (except in certain environments, where enemies still run away, which can be annoying) is very helpful, of course.

Cheers

EDIT: Ninja'd by Web, but I'll let it stand

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
That is true, no to low magic environments where the ability cap is not reached all those things are good
Good to know Web is an expert practitioner of the art of Ninja, one of the great arts of the ECB

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The most common Rage alteration I've seen is adding an AB bonus in addition to the usual bonuses. So +2/+3/+4 AB for Rage / Greater Rage / Mighty Rage.
All of the Rage feats are softcoded so they can easily be changed for custom environments. However, increasing the base STR/CON can't be done without using a 3rd party program.
